channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Give Way sign rotated 90° away from oncoming traffic at jct of Valley Rd and Shortlands Rd, Shortlands., 24th June
item.description:
Give Way sign rotated 90° away from oncoming traffic at jct of Valley Rd and Shortlands Rd, Shortlands. This is about the 6th time of reporting, repair and recurrence in two years. Please do not simply just turn it back again but apply a permanent fixing solution eg. drill two holes through the sign and pole and fix in place with a pair of nuts and long bolts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Side road warning triangle sign rotated 45° away from oncoming traffic. Lamp column on Shortlands Rd, northbound lane about 50m S of jct with Mays Hill Rd. Streetview archive image is what it looks like today, too.

item.title: The large Council paper bank container bin is full to capacity at Shortlands Station car park, 24th June
item.description:
The large Council paper bank container bin is full to capacity at Shortlands Station car park, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands. Please empty it to accommodate more recycling paper and card. Seen 21st-23rd June 2025.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Luca Court, Mays Hill Rd, Shortlands, large bin store gate opens out, and being left out, over the public footway., 24th June
item.description:
Large private flats bin store gate has been wrongly designed to open outwards over the public footway and is repeatedly left unbolted and ajar, carelessly or wind-blown, including making a hazard for all including blind and partially-sighted persons. Luca Court, Mays Hill Rd, Shortlands BR2

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): May's Hill Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: The tree outside our house is far too large and needs pruning., 24th June
item.description:
Outside 8 Wanstead Road, Bromley BR13BL. The tree outside our property is in need of urgent pruning. It has been left for far too long and has grown far too large . I fear that if left at its current size my property is at risk of damage should the tree fall during a storm or strong winds. I request that the tree is pruned as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wanstead Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins in bin area, 24th June
item.description:
The rubbish in the bin area in King House, Matthias Road, has not been collected for 2 weeks and the rubbish is overflowing. There is an ant infestation here. It’s dirty and it smells. When will this be collected please?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Matthias Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, litter, Nitrous Oxide in Perran Road, 23rd June
item.description:
Absolutely disgusting woke up to find rubbish scattered all over the street on Monday morning , the bin collection day and find the road in same disgusting condition in the evening scattered with rubbish. Plastic labels, yoghurt pot etc. Nitrous Oxide Cannisters found around bins , plants and trees on the road!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streatham Hill, London
